reviewText: Five Nights at Freddy's 3Five Nights at Freddy's is a fun all-round point & click game.... FNaF 3 takes it to the next level with various multitasking involving visuals, audial preference, and hyperventilation. FNaF 3 is meant to take place 30+ years after the first FNaF game. Another thing I had to add; I just Love how Scott made it so you could actually see the animitronics move within your area, Which scared the ever-living ♥♥♥♥ out of me when I saw it. If you haven't played FNaF 2 yet, I wouldn't suggest playing FNaF 3, Due to the multitasking.(The FNaF2 Musicbox) Anyway, To conclude: Five Nights at Freddy's a terrific game; I love the graphics; I love the super-withered hallucination animatronics, And I love the all-round game it self. If you enjoy the Five Nights at Freddy's games; I would 100%'ly suggest you to get this game. 9.8/10, Very nicely done, Scott.\nRatingsCategoryRatingGame-play8.5/10Scare Aspect10/10Story(Sequel)9/10Visuals10/10All-round Enjoyment9/10

reviewText:
I have no hate for the Five Nights at Freddy's games. In fact, they are a great game franchise. I just don't think that this one was as scary as the first, second, and fourth.

Five Nights at Freddy's 3 is great for revealing bits of the story and lore to the FNaF franchise. And I respect it for that. But I think that it could've been scarier. The only scary jumpscre in the game, in my opion, is phantom Chica's. And hers isn't all that scary either. FNaF 4 brought the scare back, with the audio, and NIGHTMARE animatronics, but this game feels too much like a filler game to complete the story, rather than another scary game. In my opion, the anticipation of the jumpscare is worse than the jumpscre itself.

Again, I have nothing against Scott and the Five Nights at Freddy's franchise, but this game isnt that scary. In my opion, anyway, the game is a little scary. This game isn't bad, the game is kinda just mediocre. I do not recommend this, and sugest you look at other FNaF titles.

reviewText: Before you all start raging at me, I'd like to sort some things out. I LOVE the Five nights's series, but this game was a gigantic dissapointment. The story was amazing but the cons outweigh the pros. The animation was clunky, the gameplay sucked, and really, ONE ANIMATRONIC! The idea sounded great on paper, but it was executed terribly. The phantom animatronics were a cool effect to the game, but they weren't scary at all. Overall this game (in my opinion) was by FAR, the worst FNAF game and its not worth $8.00. Biggest waste of money this year.

reviewText: Не мне одному понравились первые две части Five Nights at Freddy's. После 2 части все затаив дыхание ждали, ждали что 3 часть будет грандиозной, станет верхушкой Indie хорроров. Я поиграл час и дошёл до пятой ночи. Да, там было страшно первые 5 скримеров, потом ты просто запоминаешь где они появляются и это перестаёт тебя пугать. Не забываем что главная перчинка геймплея это противостояние анимотроникам, но и тут Скотт решил избавить нас от этого, так как в игре их SPOILER Это были минусы, но в этой игре есть и плюсы добавили второй планшет для усложнения, теперь нужно следить не только за комнатами, но и за всей вентиляцией, Ещё + 4 и 5 ночь действительно трудные, где нужно подгадывать где будут передвигаться наши механические друзья, НО 1 2 и 3 ночь настолько лёгкие что даже пятиклассник пройдёт и не испугается.\nВообщем подведя итог могу сказать, что игра потеряла хватку в роли хоррора и больше стала походить на лёгкий Indie Action. Но если вам понравились прошлые две части, я думаю вас ничего не остановит, так что играйте и получайте хотя бы какое то наслждание, ведь не зря мы ждали её так долго.

reviewText: I am simply amazed. As you can probably tell from my previous reviews of these games, I love the franchise and feel that Scott Cawthon has given us the perfect combination of tension, fear, and curiosity about the story surrounding these games. I will admit, when I heard that this third installment was to only feature one animatronic, I was quite skeptical about how the game would be considered difficult with only one threat to worry about. But obviously I was proven wrong in my fears. Having only worked on this game since the beginning of January, Scott has outdone himself with new and great gameplay elements as well as the same good old tension that builds up over each night in the game. The fact that you have to abuse watching the cameras is great since in the previous two games I felt they got neglected quite a bit as the game got harder. But in this one, the audio systems which you use to lure the animatronic to separate rooms, and the toggling option to switch to the vent cameras are on the main camera feed so you have to constantly go back and use it which is great. I also like how this one animatronic gives the player so many problems since it is extremely quick in it's movements and often sticks to the hidden areas of the room it is in making it difficult to spot. And while it is the only real creepy killer you have to worry about, the addition of Phantom animatronics that are figments of your imagination and won't kill you makes up for the lack of physical entities that want to kill you. And of course, the fact that the systems you use can't be used indefinitely and must always be restored is a great feature and one that builds the tension and fear since it gives the animatronic a chance to advance closer to you. Overall a surprisingly fantastic addition to the Five Nights at Freddy's series and while I heavily suspect it is the last due to there being multiple endings that tie in with the dark and mysterious story, I will always remember these games as being a great example of how sometimes in scary games like these, it is not just all about the frights and spooks.

reviewText:
Five Nights At Freddy's 3
---------------------------------

Well here we are again for the third (and possible last time) time....

Gameplay
------------------

The gameplay is a major part of the game, with bad gameplay, it wouldn't even be a game!
The basics of what you have to do is check the cameras for SpringTrap and lure him to different rooms trying to get him as far away as possible. (That sounds so easy!) Well....your wrong. You have a mechanic which you have to reboot, audio devices, camera system and ventilation (every once in a while). So you can not just stare at the camera and everytime he leaves just bring him back to the room. (Unless you have unlocked cheats and have No Errors on) The gameplay itself is fun but at times it can be boring (and repetive).
Gameplay: 7/10

Visuals/Graphics
--------------------------

Over the 3 games, the visuals have been improved. Springtrap himself looks nice and stands out from the other games.
Nothing much to say.
Visuals/Graphics: 8.5/10


Mechanics
------------------------

Reboot System
---------------
This is what kills you most of the time. If you have all 3 errors, you are basically screwed but if you are fast enough, you could make it. The reboot system is a nice mechanic that was planned by Scott since FNAF 1. I hate it when Springtrap is in the vents and I am busy rebooting all and when I am done, I get jumpscared by him. (Talk about bad timing..) It's apperance is nice and it is smooth...GG.

Play Audio
----------------
This will save your life. Luring him away from you from room to room. But, if you can't find him on the cameras, it is a certain death. The audio recharges slowly or quickly depending on the night. It's a nice mechanic and can be effective.

Vents Sealing
---------------
Not a lot to say but it's very helpful when his in CAM 15 and all the other vent cams. Well...again it's a nice mechanic.


Springtrap and Hallucinations
------------------------------------

Now, Springtrap is fairly deadly, he likes to move around a lot and also likes to kill you A LOT.  What confuses me is, shouldn't it be called Five Nights At Springtrap's? :P He is essentially the main antagonist....anyways he is a huge jerk and that's that.

The hallucinations however are very annoying, trying to keep track of Springtrap but BB just jumpscares you followed by Chica...then freddy. GOD DAMN THOSE HALLUCINATIONS!


Overall
--------------
Overall, the game is enjoyble and scary (especially when you are playing for the first time) ;)
Overall: 8.5/10

FNAF 4? ;)

reviewText:
despite what some people say (by people i mean the people who are fed up with the hype and will find any flaw to bring theese games down) the fnaf series has possibly come to its end and this game is great nonetheless.

The (possibly) Final installment to the fnaf series has arrived with a much much darker turn to the story than before, with the new maintnence mechanic of having to worry about things such as ventilation to keep those scary hallucinations at bay or camera functionality keep the newly seen springtrap animatronic in check along with the fear of seeing the hallucintations as you have to turn away from the only entrance to look at cameras. many secrets are hidden withing the game along with new completion minigames telling the story of what happend before the game takes place.

now the animatronic(s) can move in real time instead of you seeing a 2d modeled area on cameras giving the game a much more scarier atmosphere.

plus freddy's nose still honks

so despite what others may think and if this is the final game i would say you went out with a bang i reccomend

reviewText:
Was one jump scare per death not enough for you? Then how would you like the constant threat of jump scares that consequentially bring more jump scares? It's the Scott Cawthon exponential model of spooky!

So far, I'm enjoying it. The graphical quality has been upped quite a bit which is very nice. The new mechanics are a lot to manage and I still have not worked out quite how they work, even after 2 hours and some change of playing. The story is simultaneously less subtle in certain respects but more subtle in others. For example, the conversations in the phone call now openly elaborate on details that establish with reasonable certainty some things. However, mini-games (which return) are more vague than as in FNAF2.

As it stands, I'm stuck on Night 5 and I'm stressing out pretty badly trying to work everything how I think it's supposed to be worked. I cannot see myself having a sane outlook on Nights 6 and 7, if I ever make it there.

reviewText: This game is definitely best out of all the FNaF games, this one was the most fun for me. Like I liked the first cuz' it was new and really creepy. The second was way too hard and the gameplay was not very well designed. And there were too many things trying to kill you. But in this one there's only one. I know that might sound kinda boring, but there's many different ways he can kill you. And unlike the other games, instead of trying to get the animatronics OUT of your office, you try to KEEP Springtrap (The main antagonist) out. So, in order to do that, there's a little button on the cameras that you press and it plays an audio that will keep Sprigtrap in place for a little bit. But every 2 - 3 times you click the audio button, it will run out of charge and you'll have to reboot it. And while you doing that Springtrap might take a shortcut through a vent to your office. You can close the vents, but you can only have one closed at a time. Also every once in a while you'll need to let some air in, which you can do the same way you reboot the audio devices, with the maintenance panel. If you don't let air in, you'll see multiple Springtraps all over the cameras. This gives the real Springtrap a good advantage to kill you. The camera will also go blurry from time to time, but that can be rebooted too. There are also phantoms that can cause ventilation errors, and different ways to provent that from happening. So anyway, this game is the best, most fun, and creepyest of all the games. If your bored of the other games, or just bored, this is a good game to get and it's completely family friendly exept for it's really scary. Anyway I vote 368/10

reviewText: This game is definitely best out of all the FNaF games, this one was the most fun for me. Like I liked the first cuz' it was new and really creepy. The second was way too hard and the gameplay was not very well designed. And there were too many things trying to kill you. But in this one there's only one. I know that might sound kinda boring, but there's many different ways he can kill you. And unlike the other games, instead of trying to get the animatronics OUT of your office, you try to KEEP Springtrap (The main antagonist) out. So, in order to do that, there's a little button on the cameras that you press and it plays an audio that will keep Sprigtrap in place for a little bit. But every 2 - 3 times you click the audio button, it will run out of charge and you'll have to reboot it. And while you doing that Springtrap might take a shortcut through a vent to your office. You can close the vents, but you can only have one closed at a time. Also every once in a while you'll need to let some air in, which you can do the same way you reboot the audio devices, with the maintenance panel. If you don't let air in, you'll see multiple Springtraps all over the cameras. This gives the real Springtrap a good advantage to kill you. The camera will also go blurry from time to time, but that can be rebooted too. There are also phantoms that can cause ventilation errors, and different ways to provent that from happening. So anyway, this game is the best, most fun, and creepyest of all the games. If your bored of the other games, or just bored, this is a good game to get and it's completely family friendly exept for it's really scary. Anyway I vote 368/10

reviewText: So, I highly recommend this game, especially if you enjoyed the first two. If you didn't enjoy the first two, I think you'll enjoy this one. One of the many complaints" of the first two games were the fact you really only need to look at one cam in each game (Pirate Cove in FNAF1 and Prize Room in FNAF2). That's different in this game
date: especially in the harder levels. You will need to be constantly looking through the room cams and the vent cams to find him and trap him or lead him away from you. There also is only one animatronic trying to kill you
recommended: the rest are just hallucinations which will cost you time and disable a system.\n\nI've put quite some time into this game
hoursPlayed: with only about 2.5 hours into playing Nights 1-5 (getting the first and third stars) and the other 6.4 (currently at 8.9 hours) into trying to beat Nightmare mode (which I just finished and got the final star!). Now I have plenty of time to hunt for Easter Eggs :3\n\nOnce you get the hang of the game
voteText: Nights 1-4 are a walk in the park with Night 5 still putting up a fight and Nightmare mode (Night 6) being an absolute challenge
helpfulPercent: especially if you have bad luck or a bad strategy. There are [spoliler]4 Cheats[/spoiler] available once you get all 3 stars
votesHelpful: 3 of which make the game easier and 1 of which make the game harder (I think; it's called Aggressive so I believe it adds aggression rather than takes it away)
votesTotal:
so there's fun to be had with that.

All-in-all I'd give this game an 8.9/10 and there's a few spoilers about some of the stuff in game for those of you who want to know a little more.

So first off

column19: Jumpscares for getting the second star

column21: and as stated above Cheats for getting all three stars.[/spoilers] The cheats are  Fast Nights (nights go by faster
column22: I have yet to use it but I assume it's either at 1.5x speed or 2x speed)
column23: Radar (which puts a red circle on the cam Springtrap is in)
column24: Aggressive (which I assume adds aggression instead of taking it away)
column25: and No Errors (pretty simple just no errors)."

reviewText:
While I do recommend this game, I also feel like not recommending it.

The part I'm the most glad about is that it is finally vital to check all of the cameras instead of just one. In FNaF 1, you could just check the east hall corner or just check foxy depending on the strategy you use. In FNaF 2, the only camera you had to go to was the prize counter to wind up the music box. But in this one, since you need to know where Spring Trap is, you need to check around until you find him.

I am also one of those who wish there were more variations of the jumpscares to keep things interesting. After an hour trying to beat night 3, I'm finally able to get scared without my mom in the other room wondering if I'm alright. Maybe more will be patched in.

I'd also like to take the time to point out the random crashes when a night tries to start up. Sometimes it starts, sometimes it doesn't. Update: This has been fixed by Scott and has been patched in version 1.01.

Also, it seems like this game does require a bit of luck. You don't want Springtrap to be in the vents while an error occurs. That pretty much guarantees that you're dead. It takes so long for something to reset that it often becomes the reason you fail. This quickly becomes annoying. I'm close to the point to not even wanting to play it until an update occurs that balances those mechanics. I'm currently stuck on night 5.

It seems like SpringTrap is either very overpowered or I simply have the worst luck.  Or I'm just doing something completely wrong. After all, sometimes, when I play audio in room near SpringTrap, sometimes he goes to that room. Other times, he continues to waltz straight into my room and catch me. When it does work, I've been managing to keep SpringTrap in the same few rooms, so I think I'm onto a good strategy. I just happens that sometimes, errors time themselves against me and cause me to let SpringTrap in.

Not to mention, he seems to start in random places, and sometimes, I cannot find him at all. I'm sure I've learned all his hiding places. He just doesn't show up anywhere sometimes. It get incredibly frustrating. It's more frustrating than scary after you've played this for two hours.

Quite honestly, I would have bought my friend Luke his own copy. But, not anymore. Not after re-examining everything I loath about this game.

reviewText: Finally beat night 5. I will most likely try nightmare one day but for now I am happy with that. The game is not scary. Since the scares are all the same but random you will begin to hit things around your room in anger from what seems to be Springtraps randomness in his patterns in later nights.  Overall though this was a great run through. And seeing the story finally all tied together was a nice way again to see the series hopefully end and not turn into a cash cow series.

reviewText:
10/10 Would panic about Freddy walking past the window causing me to panic forgetting about springtrap again

But seriously, this game plays and feels much different than the first two games and it feels there is more strategy involved in this one compared to: (Fnaf 1) Check door, check other door, check Foxy, check door, close door, check other door, check Foxy. (Fnaf 2) Check vents, check hall, wind up box, put mask on, check vents, flash hall, wind music box. At least to me, finding a spot in which I can keep Springtrap without him entering a vent, leading me back to square one involves a lot more brain power than the first one.

The addition of animations in the game is fantastic. It makes the game feel 5x scarier, especially since it takes full use of perifferal (There is no way I spelt that right) vision. Seeing Springtrap peer in around the corner to then quickly hide behind the wall before you are able to make out what it was is amazing to the atmosphere. Freddy walking by the window definitely made me freak out a little  A lot  and may or may not of resulted in my death, and don't get me started abouut the hallucinations. The fact that you can get jumped without dieing, adds an aspect of scariness that was not in the other games. After the jump scare, that was it, where as with many of the scares in the third game don't kill you, giving you almost no time to recover in which you have to fix the vent situation and still keep an eye on what will kill you.

I highly reccomend if you are looking for a quick scare.

Playing it more and more, I am running into the problem of the game crashing while trying to start the night. It is rather annoying, but since it is easy to get back into it, its not that big a negative. I just wish the bug was not there.

reviewText: There are times I wish I could actually give a game some a mixed rating. This is one of them, unfortunately. As much as I do enjoy the lore of the Five Nights at Freddy's franchise, the gameplay in FNaF 3 just didn't keep me entertained for THAT long. The only good thing I did like about this installement is that there is a happy ending for the kids who were killed and had their souls trapped inside the animatronic suits for 30+ years.\n\nTo be honest, if you wanna know what happens, I seriously recommend that you skip this game and just watch a walkthrough on YouTube on how to get the true ending of the game and just see it yourself.
